str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From kata and a derivative of the same as Pontos; to plunge down, i.e. Submerge.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
